intro: Cryptocapnos chasmophytica, commonly known as the chasmophytic cryptocapnos, is a rare and specialized plant adapted to grow in narrow rock crevices. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant exhibits a compact growth form with small, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
